main event: A bright white light was observed in the sky near Soudan, Minnesota on September 9, 1964, hovering over Lake Vermilion. The light was round or oval in shape, approximately 100 feet in diameter, and remained stationary for about 5 minutes before suddenly accelerating and disappearing.
interesting points: Numerous witnesses reported seeing the object, including local residents and employees of a nearby taconite mine.
An on-site investigation was conducted by Air Force personnel, but no physical evidence was found.
The object was described as moving at a high rate of speed and making a 180 degree turn before disappearing.
The object was estimated to be at an altitude of around 2,000 feet.
sighted object: a bright white, round or oval-shaped light
